It may sound like a silly question, but if you're struggling with vision problems, it's an important one. With important implications.

Think of the last time you went to the zoo... 

Have you ever wondered why you never see a monkey, orangutan or other primate fumbling around, bumping into trees, or tripping over logs? It never happens.

(And don't tell me it's because they had LASIK surgery!) ;-)	Monkey with Glasses
Ã¢â‚¬Å“The real reason is this: Poor vision isn't a natural problem. It doesn't occur in nature.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½
So what does cause it then? We'll get to that, and it'll probably surprise you (hint: it's not what you've been told). But once you discover the truth, you'll also get the pleasant surprise of enjoying the following life-changing benefits:

	Enjoy 20/20 vision without having to rely on glasses or contacts

	Be more independent

Now that you know what's possible...let me show you how you can start experiencing some of these benefits for yourself, and start enjoying your life more.
Ã¢â‚¬Å“To fix your eyesight, you need to understand what's ruining it to begin withÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½

Over 100 years ago, a well-known MD by the name of Dr. William Bates studied the true causes of vision problems, and what he figured out was revolutionary. 

It turns out that our eyes are designed to see, but not in the ways we use them today.

The real problem is the strain that modern life puts on our eyes. Neither people nor animals do this in nature (remember our primate friends from earlier). 

If you've ever strained a muscle then you know exactly what I'm talking about...it simply fails to work properly once it's strained. And if you keep doing the activity that strained it to begin with, it'll continue to malfunction indefinitely. And you'll feel crippled. 

Yet our technology driven world calls for constant straining as we read books, watch television, use a computer, drive, read signs, and participate in all sorts of activities and devices... 

...ones which simply are not found in nature. 




Are you starting to see why we humans are the only species on the planet that has to deal with seeing the world in a blurry, distorted way? 

Even that isn't fully accurate, because there's no such thing as a baby with poor vision...the condition is simply one we acquire. And we acquire it because we're not using our eyes as nature intended. 

Discovering this was a major "aha" moment for me - as it may be for you. But nothing would prepare me for the "knowledge bomb" that dropped into my lap next...
Ã¢â‚¬Å“The answer was right before my eyes...literallyÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½
It was hard enough to accept that I wasn't helping people by fitting them with glasses - or what Bates called "eye crutches"...

But when I came across the following quote in his book (verified later by modern medical journals and researchers), I was floored.

			
	
 	Ã¢â‚¬Å“If glasses are worn continuously over time the poor vision will generally become worse. Essentially what glasses do is lock the eyes into their refractive state and in order to see through your lenses you have to maintain the poor vision that the lenses are designed to correct.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½

Wm H Bates: Perfect Sight Without Glasses 1920      
 	
	


This was a tough pill to swallow, as you can imagine. If it was true, I'd have to close the doors to my practice...I was supposed to be helping people see better, not worse, right?

I immediately tried the following exercise (you can try it too)...


I put on my glasses and did 2 hours worth of reading and writing. When I was done, I took them off, and looked back at the book I'd been rifling through...

Result: I was only able to see about half as well as I had before I'd put my glasses on.


The bad news was I did close down my ophthalmology office. The good news is I finally started helping people really improve their vision, effectively, naturally, safely, affordably, and permanently.
Ã¢â‚¬Å“The answer to restoring perfect vision - improving the Bates MethodÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½
Along with his research findings on why we suffer from vision disorders, Dr. Bates also proposed a series of exercises to eliminate eyestrain and reverse degenerated vision.

Although Dr. Bates' approach was the best thing out there at the time, there was still plenty of room for improvement. This is usually the case when a revolutionary new science comes along.

Now that I had made it my mission to help people see the way nature intended, I spent years doing my own research. 

Years of painstaking trial and error...

Talking with other experts in my field...

And helping people (who volunteered to try the methods I was developing) cure their vision problems, naturally...

I then combined all of this knowledge, all of my scientific discoveries, with my experience and training as an Optometrist...

To create an easy to follow program that helps you see a sharper, clearer world in as little as a few weeks' time.
